messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] school at home
messages.msgSnippet: Yes,  this is how I came to why unschooling works,  I ve taken them out of school because it doesn t work,  why would I replicate that at home??? It seems like
messages.messageBody:
Yes, this is how I came to why unschooling works, I've taken them out of school because it doesn't work, why would I replicate that at home???

It seems like such an easy conclusion doesn't it.

Kelli


Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...> wrote:2/1/03 05:10:

> I don't
> know any families where the home lessons have taken five or six hours
> a day.

I do, I do. I always figured if you were going to spend that much time
torturing your kids, why not just send them to school. At least there they
get breaks with their friends, library time, the occasional fun class, etc.

brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] school at home
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/1/03 2:34:29 AM, abtleo@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/1/03 2:34:29 AM, abtleo@... writes:

<< I always figured if you were going to spend that much time
torturing your kids, why not just send them to school. At least there they
get breaks with their friends, library time, the occasional fun class, etc. >>

Yes!
And if they hate school, they get to go home at the end of the day!

If they hate home-school, where do they get to escape?

Sandra
